subject: Re: Reg. Junit Test Sutie
msgSnippet: I m the moderator that let this request through,...normally, I just reply to that member with our stock How to use this group message. This one got me
messageBody:
I'm the moderator that let this request through,...normally, I just
reply to that member with our stock "How to use this group" message.
This one got me thinking, though,...do we have, or would we want, to
create some samples like this - really stripped down apps/classes, to
show some basic testing approaches. Or maybe I haven't dug into the
junit deploy and it already exists there,...I at least did not see a
test in there that said BoundaryConditionTest.java. :) I saw a test
for divide by zero, and some exception tests,...but what are some
other core types of tests that should be done? Boundary Conditions.
Testing a string for particular content (isAlphaNumeric,
meetsPasswordStrengthRule, etc.).

Thoughts? Or does J.B. already have a site out there, to support the
JUnit Recipes book, that would have these samples?

Dianne

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "sares140282" <sares140282@...> wrote:
>
> Hi
>
> can u send me, the example file of junit. using testsuite, boundary
> test conditions and java program also.
>
> by
> senthil
